dialogueTree.title: Un Pays Infernal: "This book is written by an angry hu..."
dialogueTree.text: This book is written by an angry humanitarian sciences doctor from the La Cherte University in Sur-La-Clef, a Dr. Benoit Mejean. He does not like Sur-La-Clef, La Cherte -- or in fact even the University he teaches in -- but what he likes even less is...

links.title: Un Pays Infernal: "Can't stand the shadow of it. This..."
links.text: Can't stand the shadow of it. This book promises to *really* get into everything that's wrong with capitalism -- to do so once and for all in an *exhaustive* and *final* manner.

links.title: Un Pays Infernal: "Critical theorists the world over a..."
links.text: Critical theorists the world over agree: once *everyone* knows *every last shortcoming* of capitalism, capitalism will end. You are but one of billions, and there are over seven billion things wrong with capitalism, but one has to start somewhere. And Benoit Mejean, PhD, wants to start with...

links.title: Inland Empire: "You feel an ominous tingling in you..."
links.text: You feel an ominous tingling in your fingertips as they browse the pages...

links.title: You: "Will this book turn me into a commi..."
links.text: Will this book turn me into a commie?

links.title: Un Pays Infernal: "Yes, it will make you a little more..."
links.text: Yes, it will make you a little more communist. Not a lot. It won't *unmake* whatever else you are but you will also become a tad bit more communist, yes.

links.title: You: "No it won't. I'm impervious to crit..."
links.text: No it won't. I'm impervious to critical theory.

links.title: Un Pays Infernal: "It will. The more communist books y..."
links.text: It will. The more communist books you read the more communist your brain becomes. That's how communism works.

links.title: You: "I don't think I want that."
links.text: I don't think I want that.

links.title: Un Pays Infernal: "Then don't read it. The more commun..."
links.text: Then don't read it. The more communist books you read the more communist your brain becomes. That's how communism works.

links.title: You: "Good. Here -- almost in the end, li..."
links.text: Good. Here -- almost in the end, limping and bleeding -- is a good time to get into some communism.

links.title: Un Pays Infernal: "Then you've found the right book. T..."
links.text: Then you've found the right book. The more communist books you read the more communist your brain becomes. That's how communism works.

links.title: Un Pays Infernal: "Sure. The more communist books you..."
links.text: Sure. The more communist books you read the more communist your brain becomes. That's how communism works.

links.title: Un Pays Infernal: "You start reading it, but it's hard..."
links.text: You start reading it, but it's hard to really understand anything. It's all some sort of garbled word-wankery. After a while you give up and put the book down.
